title: FK Tønsberg
text:
FK Tønsberg was a <a href="soccer">football</a> club from <a href="T%C3%B8nsberg">Tønsberg</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway</a>, founded on 10 October 2001 as a cooperation project between 20 local clubs. The new team replaced <a href="Eik-T%C3%B8nsberg%20IF">Eik-Tønsberg</a> in the Norwegian Second Division beginning in the <a href="2002%20Norwegian%20Second%20Division">2002 season</a>. The first player to sign for the team was Anders Skarbøvik, the former team captain. They currently play in the <a href="3.%20divisjon">Third Division</a>.
FK Tønsberg came second in their Second Division group in <a href="2002%20Norwegian%20Second%20Division">2002</a> and <a href="2003%20Norwegian%20Second%20Division">2003</a>. In <a href="2004%20Norwegian%20Second%20Division">2004</a> they hired experienced coach <a href="Reine%20Almqvist">Reine Almqvist</a>, won the group and was promoted to the <a href="Adeccoligaen">First Division</a>. They were relegated after only one season. They have since fluctuated between the Second and Third Divisions.
On 1 January 2020, FK Tønsberg merged with <a href="Eik-T%C3%B8nsberg">Eik-Tønsberg</a> and became part of <a href="FK%20Eik%20T%C3%B8nsberg">FK Eik Tønsberg</a>.
